Patients with Epileptic Encephalopathy, Early Infantile, 30 present clinical features that include epilepsy, intellectual disability, and developmental delay. The disease is caused by mutations in the KCNQ2 gene, which encodes the Kv7.2 voltage-gated potassium channel.
